episodes.title: Mica Miller's Husband Linked to Friend’s Drowning Death: Lawyer
episodes.description:
Rumors and speculation about South Carolina pastor JP Miller have swirled since his wife Mica took her own life last year. In the latest twist, there are reports that law enforcement could be opening an investigation into the death of a family friend. Miller reportedly started dating the man's wife soon after his death. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber spoke with the attorney for Mica Miller’s family, Regina Ward, about the latest allegations.

episodes.description:

Sergio Guardi was found guilty of burglary and stalking after he broke into a woman’s home and snuck through her teenage daughter’s bedroom. Law&Crime’s Chris Stewart dissects the terrifying footage on this episode of On the Case.

episodes.title: Lawsuit Mentions Ruby Franke's Friend and Role in ConneXions
episodes.description:
Pam Bodtcher, reportedly a best friend of convicted child abusers Ruby Franke and Jodi Hildebrandt, is mentioned in a civil lawsuit against Hildebrandt’s life coaching company ConneXions. While Bodtcher was not named as a defendant in the suit, details regarding her apparent involvement in the company and her alleged knowledge of how the Franke children were treated have come to light. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber takes a closer look at it all.

episodes.description:
Doomsday Cult mom Lori Vallow Daybell is expected to be in court Tuesday morning. Last year, Daybell was convicted for the murders of her daughter, Tylee, and son, JJ in Idaho. Now she faces charges in Arizona for allegedly orchestrating the murder of her fourth husband, Charles Vallow and attempting to have her niece’s husband murdered, Brandon Boudreaux.

episodes.description:
Ruby Franke, the once-beloved mommy vlogger behind 8 Passengers, is now serving up to 30 years in prison for child abuse. How did a family YouTube channel spiral into a nightmare of control and unimaginable cruelty? Law&Crime's Jesse Weber breaks down the most disturbing details from the Hulu documentary Devil in the Family: The Fall of Ruby Franke, including never-before-seen footage, chilling journal entries, and interviews with her estranged husband and children.

episodes.title: HEARING: P. Diddy Trafficking Indictment – Live Analysis
episodes.description:
P. Diddy, real name Sean Combs, was indicted by a federal grand jury on several charges including racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking. The music mogul has been denied bail numerous times, despite his attorneys’ continuous fight for his release. Friday, Diddy is expected to appear in a New York City courtroom for a hearing to discuss the timeline and discovery surrounding his case. Join Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber and our team of legal analysts as we bring you real-time updates from the courtroom.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Judge Makes Big Ruling on Controversial Jail Cell Search
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs and his attorneys have argued for months that a search of the incarcerated music mogul’s jail cell violated his constitutional rights. The defense claims the prosecution used information gathered in that search against Combs, despite some of his notes being labeled as “legal.” They also claim a Bureau of Prisons investigator was working on behalf of the prosecution to find dirt on Combs. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber takes a look at the judge’s decision on the matter.

episodes.title: Mica Miller Death Investigation: Everything We Know About the Disturbing Case
episodes.description:

episodes.title: P. Diddy Rents Out Private Jet While Fighting Sex Trafficking Charges
episodes.description:
P. Diddy’s private jet is now available to rent. His defense team and staff members have been working to sell it, promising the judges overseeing his case that he won’t have access to it and doesn’t want it — and therefore wouldn’t use it — as an effort to convince them to let him out of jail. Trips on the plane cost anywhere from about $100,000 to $450,000. Law&Crime’s Elizabeth Millner has the latest developments in the sex trafficking case.

episodes.description:

Combs has pleaded not guilty to racketeering and sex trafficking charges and has made several requests to be released on bail with conditions. Prosecutors have fought the request at every turn. The request for bail comes as the judge presiding over his case ruled on Combs' latest request for a gag order barring witnesses and their lawyers from commenting on the case. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy looks at the latest developments in this episode of Crime Fix  — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Still Posts on Instagram While in Jail to 'Spread Positivity'
episodes.description:
As Sean “Diddy” Combs sits behind bars in New York, facing federal racketeering and sex crimes charges, his son, Christian “King” Combs announced he was taking over his father’s Instagram page. The page, which has only a few posts since the music mogul shut it down earlier this year, now features several of Combs’ old music videos. Christian Combs says he wants to “spread positivity” and remind him of the good things about his father. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber spoke with celebrity criminal defense attorney Brian McMonagle about the impact this could have in a federal courtroom, as well as the court of public opinion.

episodes.title: Diddy's Ex-Girlfriend Cassie Fires Back at Rapper's Gag Order Bid
episodes.description:
Lawyers for Sean "Diddy" Combs have asked the judge presiding over his racketeering and sex trafficking case to issue a gag order preventing witnesses in the case from discussing it publicly. The move comes after a man named Courtney Burgess claimed he possessed videos of Combs engaged in sex acts with celebrities - including two minors - and that he testified in front of the grand jury. Cassie Ventura's lawyer, Douglas Wigdor, has asked Judge Arun Submaranian to deny Combs' request. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy looks at the issue in this episode of Crime Fix  — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: P. Diddy and JLo Fought Before Rapper Allegedly Raped 13-Year-Old: Report
episodes.description:
Photos have surfaced from January 2000 that show Sean "Diddy" Combs and his then-girlfriend, singer Jennifer Lopez, appearing to argue at an MTV Video Music Awards afterparty. Questions have been raised about that night after a woman filed a lawsuit claiming Combs sexually assaulted her at a house that night when she was 13. The suit claims an unnamed male and female celebrity were present at the time of the assault. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy looks at the suit and claims the couple argued that night in this episode of Crime Fix  — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

Diddy immediately settled the case within 24 hours, while simultaneously refusing to settle other civil lawsuits. Still, the government claims otherwise. Law&Crime’s Elizabeth Millner breaks down the mystery surrounding the most disturbing piece of evidence released in Diddy’s case so far.

episodes.description:
A California John Doe says he was just 10 years old in 2005 when a “consultant” connected him and his parents to Sean “Diddy” Combs. The man says he hoped Combs could help him break into the entertainment world, but instead, he claims he was given a drugged soda and then raped while he was unconscious. A second lawsuit filed on the same day by a different John Doe accuses Combs of sexual assault during an audition for the MTV show “Making the Band.” Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber has details on both filings.

Sean "Diddy" Combs was indicted on charges of sex trafficking and racketeering after a lengthy federal investigation. The famed music mogul also faces numerous allegations of abuse in dozens of civil lawsuits. From seemingly being on top of the world to sitting inside a New York City jail cell, Diddy's rise and fall has shocked the nation. Liz Scherer reacts to key pieces in Diddy's case and actions taken by the disgraced rapper.

Retired Florida Circuit Court Judge Elizabeth Scherer, best known for presiding over the Parkland School Shooting trial, brings her legal expertise to the screen in a fresh and dynamic digital series. In Judge Reacts, she dives into the world of law and true crime, offering sharp insights on gripping courtroom moments and real-life legal dramas. With her signature no-nonsense approach, Judge Liz invites viewers to become her jury, exploring both the serious and complex sides of the justice system. Tune in for a compelling insider's perspective on the law.

episodes.title: Prime Crime: The Rise and Fall of P. Diddy
episodes.description:
Sean "Diddy" Combs is arguably one of the most powerful moguls in the music industry. Throughout his decades-long career, Diddy has amassed wealth and a sphere of influence that spans all entertainment industries. The famed music mogul's ex-girlfriend Casandra Ventura filed a lawsuit against Combs in November 2023, which he settled in one day, opening the floodgates to other civil lawsuits. Months later, Diddy's home in Miami and Los Angeles were raided by the feds in connection with an investigation into trafficking and racketeering. Get an inside look at the rise and fall of P. Diddy on this true-crime documentary episode of "Prime Crime with Jesse Weber."

episodes.title: P. Diddy Begs for Bail Again, Takes Fight to Higher Court
episodes.description:
Sean "Diddy" Combs has filed an appeal asking a higher court to overrule to judges who've denied him bail. Combs has pleaded not guilty to federal racketeering and sex trafficking charges and is being held without bond. His lawyers argue he's not a flight risk and hasn't tried to intimidate witnesses as federal prosecutors have claimed. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy goes through some of the reasons why Combs believes he should be released in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: Inside P. Diddy’s Life in NYC’s ‘Horrific’ Federal Jail
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs was denied bond twice by two different federal judges after being arrested on racketeering and sex trafficking charges. The famed music mogul’s defense pleaded with the courts to let Diddy walk free ahead of trial. Diddy’s team was still denied after offering $50 million for bail and restrictions, such as prohibiting “female visitors” from coming to his house. Diddy will await trial in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York. Law&Crime’s Elizabeth Millner breaks down Diddy’s life inside jail.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Pushes Judge to Release Him from Jail with ‘No Female Visitors’
episodes.description:
The famed music mogul accused of hosting “freak offs” fueled by illegal drugs is fighting to be released from custody ahead of his trial. Sean “Diddy” Combs was arraigned on Tuesday after being indicted on charges of racketeering conspiracy, sex trafficking, and transportation to engage in prostitution. Diddy is back in court today for an appeal after the judge denied his bail. His defense offered a bail condition that Diddy would restrict all females from visiting him, other than his family and close friends not involved in the allegations. Law&Crime’s Elizabeth Millner, who was at the courthouse on Tuesday, takes a look at what happened in court yesterday and what’s ahead for Diddy.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Fights $100 Million Judgment After Inmate Won Sexual Assault Case
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs wants a Michigan judge to set aside a massive default judgment against him, saying he was improperly served notice of the lawsuit and can also prove that the allegations are false. Derrick Lee Cardello-Smith, a prison inmate, claims Combs drugged and sexually assaulted him at a party in 1996. Because Combs didn’t respond to the suit, the court entered a default judgment against him for $100 million. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber breaks down why Combs’ attorneys call Cardello-Smith’s legal action “made up.”

episodes.title: Mom of Diddy's Son Breaks Silence After Ex-Girlfriend Beating Video Surfaces
episodes.description:
Misa Hylton, the mother of Sean Combs' son, Justin Combs, offered support for Cassie Ventura following the release of the 2016 video that showed Combs assaulting her in a hotel hallway. Hylton made the comments on Instagram with a post of Combs' seven children and said seeing the video triggered her own trauma. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy looks at Hylton's comments and how the video may have become public with attorneys Robin Nunn and Bradford Cohen in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Fires Back at Jane Doe Lawsuit: 'Decades-Old Tale'
episodes.description:
Sean "Diddy" Combs has filed a motion to dismiss a lawsuit filed by a "Jane Doe" from Canada who claimed Combs and two other men gang-raped her in 2003. The woman said she was 17 at the time and was flown from Detroit to New York City on a private jet for sex. Combs claims the woman's suit should be dismissed for at least three legal reasons as he denies the allegations. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy outlines Combs' argument and the woman's claims in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber analyzes the latest disturbing evidence and testimony presented at trial.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Accuser Cites 'New Evidence' in Sexual Assault Case
episodes.description: One of the women accusing Sean “Diddy” Combs of sexual assault, Liza Gardner, wants to move her civil lawsuit against the music mogul from New York to New Jersey. Gardner’s attorneys say new witnesses have come forward to corroborate her allegations of rape against Combs and singer-songwriter Aaron Hall. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber discusses the move with celebrity defense attorney Bradford Cohen. A singer claims P. Diddy tried buying her silence in a recent deal to give her the publishing rights to her music in exchange for signing an NDA. Aubrey O’Day, who was signed to Bad Boy Records in the early 2000s, said other artists signed the agreement. O’Day then went on to say she got wind of what was coming for Diddy in September 2023, nearly six months before the music mogul’s homes were raided. Law&Crime’s Sierra Gillespie breaks it down.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Files Bombshell Motion to Dismiss Revenge Porn, Trafficking Claims
episodes.description: Sean “P. Diddy'' Combs has officially responded to one of the huge lawsuits filed against him. Joi Dickerson-Neal claims Combs drugged and raped her after a date in 1991. She also claims Combs filmed the assault and shared it widely with friends. Combs’ attorneys claim Dickerson-Neal cannot bring claims against Combs using laws that didn’t exist at the time of the alleged assault. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber analyzes the lengthy motion and its implications. episodes.title: P. Diddy: Feds Working with Sex Assault Accusers?
episodes.description:
Several accusers of Sean "Diddy" Combs have filed civil lawsuits since November 2023 accusing him of sexual assault, physical abuse, and trafficking. Combs has denied the allegations but that hasn't stopped an investigation and raids by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. The lawsuits and raid that followed have prompted questions about what came first: the civil suits or the criminal investigation and whether federal prosecutors are working in lockstep with lawyers for the accusers. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy talks with two former federal prosecutors and a former Homeland Security trainer about the suspicions in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

Chad Daybell is accused of killing two of his second wife’s children, as well as his own first wife, because he believed they were possessed. Two weeks after his wife Tammy’s unexpected death, Chad married Lori Vallow. Vallow was convicted last year of her role in the triple homicide. This week, prosecutors unveiled new footage of Daybell sitting in the back of a police car as investigators searched his property. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber analyzes the new footage as Daybell’s first week of trial continues.

episodes.title: Ruby Franke’s Husband Slaps Jodi Hildebrandt with Lawsuit for Torturing His Kids
episodes.description:
Kevin Franke, soon-to-be-ex-husband of former YouTube mom and convicted child abuser Ruby Franke, says therapist Jodi Hildebrandt forced him to move away from his family and have no contact with them. During that time, his wife and Hildebrandt were abusing the couple’s two youngest children in an attempt to expel alleged demons. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber and Sierra Gillespie spoke with Kevin Franke’s attorney, Randy Kester, about the lawsuit’s causes of action and the hoped-for result.

episodes.title: ‘Doomsday Cult’ Prophet Murder Trial: 6 Shocking Moments from Opening Statements
episodes.description: Chad Daybell, husband of convicted killer Lori Vallow Daybell, is on trial in Idaho for allegedly killing his first wife and two of his new wife’s children. During their opening statements, the prosecution and defense laid out what the jury can expect to see and hear over the next several weeks. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber recaps the case and the top moments from day one of the trial. episodes.title: P. Diddy and Tupac Shakur's Murder: 'There's Some Truth To It,' Detective Says
episodes.description:
Years before federal agents raided Sean “Diddy” Combs’ homes in a sex trafficking probe, the mogul had other brushes with the law. In 1999, he was charged and later acquitted in a shooting at a New York nightclub and his name has come up many times in the Tupac Shakur murder investigation. Law&Crime’s Angenette Levy talks with former federal prosecutor Tim Jansen and Derrick Parker, a retired NYPD detective who arrested Combs in 1999, about the latest investigation and a possible connection to Tupac Shakur’s murder in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

Recordings of Ruby Franke and Jodi Hildebrandt while they were in jail shed light on what was going through the duo’s minds after they were arrested for child abuse. Both Franke and Hildebrandt appeared to justify their cruel acts, with Ruby saying “Children can be full of evil” and Jodi claiming “No one wants the truth.” The pair pleaded guilty to four counts of child abuse and were locked up in prison. Law&Crime’s Sierra Gillespie and Elizabeth Millner break down key highlights of their jailhouse calls.

episodes.title: 6 Shocking Revelations from Ruby Franke's Child Abuse Journal: 'Selfish Children'
episodes.description:
Youtuber turned convicted felon and child abuser Ruby Franke detailed three months of physical and psychological abuse that she and Jodi Hildebrandt inflicted upon her 12-year-old son and 10-year-old daughter in the summer of 2023. Franke claimed her children were visited by satan and demons. The children were forced to perform harsh physical labor and endure starvation. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy talks with forensic psychiatrist Dr. Daniel Bober about Franke's journal and the revelations in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show that delves into the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: Cops Find Ruby Franke’s Young Daughter Scared, Hiding in Jodi Hildebrandt’s Bathroom Closet
episodes.description:
Bodycam footage shows police searching Jodi Hildebrandt’s Utah home after Ruby Franke’s 12-year-old son escaped and rushed to a neighbor’s home for help on August 30, 2023. The video shows officers rushing into Hildebrandt’s home after detaining her and searching every room until they find Franke’s daughter, who was scared and hiding in a bathroom closet. Law&Crime’s Elizabeth Millner breaks down how officers found the young girl and what happened next.

episodes.title: Ruby Franke’s Son Begs for Help After Escaping Jodi Hildebrandt’s Home
episodes.description:
Video shows Ruby Franke’s son after he escaped Jodi Hildebrandt’s home on August 30, 2023. The 12-year-old, who was emaciated, broke free from being tied up and rushed to a neighbor’s home while covered in duct tape. The young boy asked Hildebrandt’s neighbors to take him to the nearest police station. Franke and Hildebrandt were arrested later that day. The duo pleaded guilty to four counts of aggravated child abuse in connection to this incident. Law&Crime’s Sierra Gillespie breaks down all the evidence from her son’s brave escape.

episodes.title: Bodycam: Ruby Franke Appears Angry, Annoyed While Getting Arrested for Child Abuse
episodes.description:
Bodycam footage shows Ruby Franke being arrested on August 30, 2023, after her 12-year-old son escaped from Jodi Hildebrandt’s home, begging her neighbors to take him to the police station. The YouTube mom appears angry and annoyed as officers put handcuffs on her and take her to the police department. The officer who transported Ruby to the department noted that she is “definitely not a talker,” noting how she remained silent whenever possible. Franke was charged with multiple counts of child abuse, four of which she pleaded guilty to.

episodes.description:
After two of Ruby Franke’s children were found bruised and covered with duct tape, her husband, Kevin Franke, was questioned by Utah police. In his interview on August 30, 2023, Kevin Franke said he trusted Jodi Hildebrandt and claimed she was a very honest and truthful person. When police told him what had happened to his children, he said “this sounds like a made up story” and it sounded like “a horror movie.”

episodes.title: Ruby Franke and Jodi Hildebrandt Questioned by Cops After Child Abuse Arrest
episodes.description:
Bodycam footage shows Ruby Franke and Jodi Hildebrandt being questioned by police after they were arrested on August 30, 2023. Authorities took the duo into custody after Franke’s 12-year-old son escaped from Hildebrandt’s home covered in wounds and duct tape. Ruby appeared stone-faced and remained silent while officers asked her questions. “I’ll wait till I have a lawyer,” the YouTube mom said after refusing to answer questions. Hildebrandt told police she was advised by her attorney to not answer any questions. “I’m a psychologist, I watch people flip things all the time,” Hildebrandt insisted.

episodes.title: Andrew Tate Faces New Sex Crimes Charges Following Adin Ross Exposing His Plans
episodes.description:
Controversial social media influencer Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan were once again arrested by Romanian authorities, this time accused of sex crimes in the United Kingdom. Attorneys for the alleged victims rushed to request extradition after Twitch streamer Adin Ross mentioned during a live stream that Tate planned to soon leave Romania. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber speaks with the UK attorneys behind the extradition request, Jack Beeston and Matthew Jury.

episodes.title: ‘Concentration Camp’: Ruby Franke Prosecutor Details Horrific Abuse Faced by YouTube Mom’s Kids
episodes.description:
Ruby Franke and Jodi Hildebrandt were sentenced on Tuesday for their involvement in a child abuse case that prosecutor Eric Clarke described as the most horrific instance he has ever encountered in his career. Following the sentencing, Clarke spoke to the media, expressing his thoughts on the severity of the abuse suffered by Franke's children. He drew a comparison between the children's experiences and the conditions endured by victims in concentration camps, underscoring the extreme nature of the cruelty and neglect inflicted upon the young victims.

episodes.title: Ruby Franke Business Partner Jodi Hildebrandt Took Plea So Children Didn’t Have to Testify: Defense
episodes.description:
After making a plea agreement in court Wednesday, Jodi Hildebrant’s defense attorney, Douglas Terry, spoke to local media reporters outside a Utah courthouse. Terry said Hildebrandt chose to take a plea agreement before Ruby Franke did, and that she wanted to take one so the children didn’t have to testify. “Her main focus is for the children to be able to heal,” Terry said. Hildebrandt will be sentenced in February.

episodes.title: YouTube Mom Ruby Franke Pleads Guilty to Felony Child Abuse Charges
episodes.description:
YouTube mom Ruby Franke appeared in court Monday and pleaded guilty to four felony child abuse charges. Franke was arrested in August 2023 after two of her children were found bound in duct tape and had wounds covering their bodies. She — along with her business partner Jodi Hildebrandt — was originally charged with six child abuse charges when Franke's son escaped from Hildebrandt's Utah home. Full details of Franke's plea agreement have not yet been released.

episodes.title: Ruby Franke’s Business Associate Grilled by Cops After Kids Allegedly Found ‘Locked in a Safe’
episodes.description:
Ruby Franke’s business associate, Pam Bodtchr, was interrogated by American Fork, Utah officers on August 30 after two of Franke’s children were allegedly found malnourished and locked in a safe. “A safe!?” Bodtcher exclaimed when an officer told her about what had happened earlier that day — four hours south — in Ivans, Utah. Two of Franke’s children were found bound in duct tape at Jodi Hildebrant’s home, who is another one of Franke’s business partner. Two of Franke’s other children were found inside Bodtcher’s home the day of Franke’s arrest. Botcher told investigators Franke had called her stating she had a family emergency, so Bodtcher picked the other two children up, brought them back to her home, and claimed the children helped clean up the house, ate lunch, then got ice cream while Franke dealt with her emergency.

#RubyFranke #Bodycam #LawandCrime

episodes.title: The Twisted Case of Ruby Franke — Everything We Know
episodes.description:
The YouTube channel “8 Passengers” was once a powerhouse in the family content space on the platform, boasting millions of views each month with over two million subscribers. Ruby Franke and her husband, Kevin Franke, launched the channel in 2015 with a major focus on their six children and parenting skills in their vlog-style videos. The channel’s success came crashing down when YouTube terminated the account just days after Ruby Franke’s 12-year-old son escaped from her business partner’s home “covered in wounds” after he was allegedly tied up using duct tape and starved to the point of emaciation. The Law&Crime Network’s Jesse Weber breaks down the timeline of Ruby Franke’s rise and fall on the YouTube platform.

episodes.description:
Utah woman Ruby Franke, and her alleged accomplice Jodi Hildebrandt, were both charged with six counts of felony child abuse after the YouTube mom’s 12-year-old emaciated son escaped Hildebrandt’s home with open wounds and duct tape on his wrists on August 30. The Law&Crime Network’s Angenette Levy discusses the disturbing case with Franke’s cousin, who says the child abuse case is “bigger than people know.” Franke’s cousin, who is using the alias “Sally,” asked to remain anonymous with her face blurred and voice distorted. Vallow, along with her daughter, Tylee Ryan, and husband’s late wife, Tammy Daybell. “Let’s give em’ hell, guys,” Woodcock said as he walked through the courthouse door.

episodes.title: Inside ‘Doomsday Cult’ Mom Trial: ‘Does Lori Vallow Daybell Think Jurors Are Zombies?’
episodes.description:
The jury is set in the trial of "Doomsday Cult" mom Lori Vallow Daybell in Idaho. Eight women and 10 men make up the jury which includes six alternates. The Law&Crime Network's Angenette Levy talks with GiGi McKelvey about Daybell's demeanor in the courtroom and what she did throughout jury selection. Plus, former Idaho Attorney General Dave Leroy discusses the significance of what will likely be the state's most anticipated trial in a century and the evidence the jury will see.

episodes.title: 'Doomsday Cult' Mom Trial: Will Lori Daybell's ‘Prophet’ Hubby, Brother be Blamed for Kids' Murders?
episodes.description:
The defense team for “Doomsday cult” mom Lori Vallow Daybell has already submitted an alibi they claim proves she wasn’t with her children when they were murdered. The question remains, will her defense blame the murders of J.J. Vallow and Tylee Ryan on her “prophet” husband Chad Daybell or her late brother Alex Cox? The Law&Crime Network’s Jesse Weber and GiGi McKelvey, who’s at the courthouse for jury selection, discuss what Lori’s defense may look like.

episodes.title: Could Lori Vallow Daybell's Niece Be Charged In Attempted Murder Conspiracy?
episodes.description:
“Doomsday cult” mom Lori Vallow Daybell’s niece, Melani Pawlowski, was arrested for alleged criminal trespassing with a domestic violence enhancement in November 2019. One month before that, Pawlowski’s then-husband, Brandon Boudreaux, was shot at outside of his Arizona home. In a recently released indictment against Daybell for conspiracy to commit murder, authorities allege Daybell’s brother, Alex Cox, was the gunman who tried to shoot Boudreaux. The question of whether Pawlowski was involved with her ex-husband’s attempted murder remains unanswered. The Law&Crime Network’s Angenette Levy has the details.

Reporter:
Angenette Levy: https://twitter.com/Angenette5

episodes.title: ‘She IS a Killer’: Prosecutor Slams Lori Vallow Daybell, Urges Jury to Lock Her Up
episodes.description:
Prosecutor Rob Wood fired back at the defense’s closing argument with a powerful rebuttal Thursday before the jury was sent off to decide “doomsday cult” mom Lori Vallow Daybell’s fate. “She IS a killer,” Wood said after hammering Daybell for all the lies she told surrounding her children’s deaths. Wood focused on specific pieces of direct and circumstantial evidence linking Lori to the killings of J.J. Vallow and Tylee Ryan. Daybell is also accused of conspiring to murder “prophet” Chad Daybell’s late wife, Tammy Daybell.

#LoriVallowDaybell #LoriVallow #LawAndCrime

episodes.title: Lori Vallow Daybell’s Lawyer Blames Triple Murders on ‘Prophet’ Husband — Full Closing Argument
episodes.description:
Lori Vallow Daybell’s attorney, Jim Archibald, presented the defense’s closing argument Thursday. Archibald insisted the “doomsday cult” mom was innocent and shifted the blame for the murders to Chad Daybell, Lori’s fifth husband. "She thinks Chad is following Jesus but he’s not. He’s, unfortunately, being led by the storm. Not the first guy to be led by the storm,” Archibald said. He continued ranting about the “lack of evidence” linking Daybell to the killings, claiming she knew nothing about her kids, J.J. Vallow and Tylee Ryan, being buried in Chad’s backyard. Archibald went as far as blaming Lori’s brother, Alex Cox, for the children’s death. Daybell stands accused of murdering both of her kids, along with her “prophet” husband’s late wife, Tammy Daybell.

#LoriVallowDaybell #LoriVallow #LawAndCrime

Chad and Lori are accused of killing two of Lori’s children, J.J. Vallow and Tylee Ryan, along with Chad’s late wife, Tammy.

episodes.title: Tammy Daybell Had ‘Bruising’ and ‘Dry Foam’ On Her Body, Medical Officer Says
episodes.description:
The chief medical officer who performed the autopsy on Tammy Daybell after her body was exhumed confirmed she had bruises that most likely formed at the time of her murder. During Dr. Erik Christensen’s testimony in court Monday, he testified that the bruising was consistent with restraint, which is common with her cause of death: asphyxia. The medical officer also said a "dry foam" was found in her airways. Lori Vallow Daybell is currently on trial for Tammy’s murder, along with the murders of two of her children, Tylee Ryan and J.J. Vallow.

#TammyDaybell #LoriVallowDaybell #LawAndCrime

episodes.title: Cult Experts Dissect the ‘Doomsday Cult’ of Lori Vallow and Chad Daybell — Was She Brainwashed?
episodes.description:
“Doomsday cult” mom Lori Vallow Daybell currently faces trial for allegedly murdering her two children, J.J. Vallow and Tylee Ryan, along with her fifth husband’s late wife, Tammy Daybell. Was Lori brainwashed and indoctrinated by “prophet” Chad Daybell? Friends of Lori Daybell said the accused killer claimed she was a goddess and spewed other radical end-times beliefs, but did she really believe these things? The Law&Crime Network’s Angenette Levy discusses the “doomsday cult” with cult expert Dr. Christine Marie and Dr. Steve Hassan, a former member of the “moonies” cult within the Unification Church.

episodes.title: 'Doomsday Prophet’ Chad Daybell Didn’t Want Autopsy Performed On Dead Wife, Coroner Testifies
episodes.description:
The coroner who examined Tammy Daybell’s body when she was found dead by her husband, Chad Daybell, said the "doomsday prophet" told her Tammy had been “feeling off” lately. Chad told the coroner, Brenda Dye, he had moved Tammy’s body because she had fallen off the bed — Dye admitted she found it odd that a dead body had fallen off the couple’s bed but claimed when questioned about it, Chad said he must have pulled the top sheet too hard when he rolled over in his sleep. Chad and his new wife, Lori Vallow Daybell, are accused of murdering Tammy, along with Lori’s two children Tylee Ryan and J.J. Vallow.

episodes.title: Tylee Ryan’s Heart Was ‘Charred And Shrunken,’ Pathologist Testifies
episodes.description:
During the "doomsday cult" mom’s triple murder trial, a pathologist testified that Tylee Ryan’s death was classified as a homicide by “unspecific means” — meaning he couldn’t pinpoint exactly what caused her death. Dr. Garth Warren said Tylee’s autopsy was unusual because her body came into his office in multiple different bags. The pathologist confirmed her heart was severely decomposed, charred and shrunken. Lori Vallow Daybell, Tylee’s mother, is accused of killing her and her 7-year-old brother, J.J. Vallow. She’s also suspected of killing her fifth husband’s late wife.

#TyleeRyan #LoriVallowDaybell #LawAndCrime

episodes.title: J.J. Vallow Was Smothered to Death, Burned In Fire Pit Wearing His Pajamas: Pathologist
episodes.description:
The forensic pathologist who performed the autopsy of J.J. Vallow testified in court Wednesday during the 'doomsday cult' mom triple murder trial. Dr. Garth Warren confirmed the 7-year-old died of asphyxia with a plastic bag over his head and duct tape was found covering his mouth. The lower half of J.J.’s body was found in a burn pit, wearing his pajamas. Lori Vallow Daybell, J.J.’s mother, is currently on trial for his and his sister’s murders. Lori is also accused of killing her fifth husband's late wife.

#JJVallow #LoriVallowDaybell #LawAndCrime

episodes.title: How Lori Vallow Daybell's Ex-Husband Was Shot and Killed by 'Doomsday Cult' Mom's Brother
episodes.description:
Lori Vallow Daybell’s ex-husband Charles Vallow was shot and killed by the “doomsday cult” mom’s brother, Alex Cox, in July 2019. Cox claimed the shooting was in self-defense after Vallow allegedly attacked him. Investigators later determined Vallow’s death was a homicide and charged Daybell with conspiracy to commit murder, alleging that she planned Vallow’s death with her brother. Alex Cox died of natural causes just months after shooting Vallow to death. The Law&Crime Network’s Angenette Levy breaks down the full story. 

Reporter:
Angenette Levy: https://twitter.com/sierragillespie

episodes.description:
“You ripped my heart out, you ripped our entire family’s hearts out,” Colby Ryan shouted during a jailhouse phone call with ‘doomsday cult’ mom Lori Vallow Daybell. Ryan, Daybell’s eldest son, testified in court Tuesday, telling jurors about how she changed when she met her fifth husband, Chad Daybell. “You don’t even know,” Lori said to her son about the murders in the call. “You are a murderer,” Ryan concluded. Lori is accused of killing two of her children, Tylee Ryan and J.J. Vallow, along with Chad's late wife, Tammy Daybell.

From zombies — to spell castings — and bizarre audio recordings, the first week of Lori Vallow Daybell’s triple murder trial has been anything but ordinary. The ‘doomsday cult’ mom is accused of killing two of her children, Tylee Ryan and J.J. Vallow, along with her fifth husband’s late wife, Tammy Daybell. The Law&Crime Network’s Angenette Levy details the most shocking moments from this unique trial so far.

episodes.title: Wife of 'Doomsday Mom' Lori Vallow Daybell's Dead Brother Gives Head-Turning Testimony About Cult
episodes.description:
Zulema Pastenes, Lori Vallow Daybell's former sister-in-law, gave head-turning testimony in the 'doomday cult' mom's triple murder trial Friday. Daybell's brother, Alex Cox, was married to Pastenes but died of "natural causes." In 2019, Cox shot and killed Lori's fourth husband, Charles Vallow, in what he alleged was self defense. The Law&Crime Network's Gigi McIvery has a break down of the interesting and strange things the sister-in-law has said so far.

#Zeluma #LoriVallowDaybell #LawAndCrime

episodes.title: Inside ‘Doomsday Cult’ Mom Trial: ‘Does Lori Vallow Daybell Think Jurors Are Zombies?’
episodes.description:
The jury is set in the trial of "Doomsday Cult" mom Lori Vallow Daybell in Idaho. Eight women and 10 men make up the jury which includes six alternates. The Law&Crime Network's Angenette Levy talks with GiGi McKelvey about Daybell's demeanor in the courtroom and what she did throughout jury selection. Plus, former Idaho Attorney General Dave Leroy discusses the significance of what will likely be the state's most anticipated trial in a century and the evidence the jury will see.

episodes.title: Charred Remains & Asphyxiation: Lori Vallow’s Alleged Victims’ Cause of Death Revealed
episodes.description:
During opening statements Monday, prosecutors revealed gruesome details about how Lori Vallow Daybell’s alleged victims died. The prosecution said the remains of Tylee Ryan, the defendant’s daughter, were charred and her hands were gone. Lori’s son, J.J. Vallow, had his hands bound and duct taped. Tammy Daybell, Lori’s fifth husband’s late wife, died of asphyxiation.

Lori Vallow Daybell is on trial in Idaho for her alleged role in the murders of her children, Tylee Ryan and J.J. episodes.title: ‘Fragile State of Mind’: Lori Vallow Daybell Asks To Leave Court During Testimony About Autopsies
episodes.description:
The attorneys for ‘doomsday cult’ mom Lori Vallow Daybell motioned to allow their client to leave the courtroom during the presentation and discussion of her children’s autopsy evidence. Daybell is accused of killing two of her kids, Tylee Ryan and J.J. Vallow. “It was an emotional morning,” her attorney said. “She has a fragile state of mind.” Ultimately, the judge ruled against their motion, requiring Daybell to stay inside the courtroom for the full testimony.

#LoriVallowDaybell #DoomsdayCultMomTrial #LawAndCrime

The grandparents of J.J. Vallow, the slain adopted son of Lori Vallow Daybell, believe their grandson was being denied medication shortly before he was murdered. Kay and Larry Woodcock reflected on how the 7-year-old’s demeanor changed before he disappeared and his mother’s behavior leading up to his death. Lori Vallow Daybell, is heading to trial for her son’s murder and the murder of her daughter, Tylee Ryan.

episodes.title: Polygamist Cult 'Prophet' Sam Bateman Caught Towing Underage Girls in Trailer with Porta-Potty
episodes.description:
WATCH: Bodycam footage shows Arizona police arresting polygamist cult "prophet" Samuel Bateman after he was found traveling with underage girls inside a squalid trailer in August. Authorities said a witness told police he saw human fingers poking out of Bateman's trailer prior to the traffic stop. The video shows officers questioning the self-proclaimed "prophet" about who he's traveling with before opening the trailer and discovering the disturbing conditions inside. The trailer along with the girls appeared to have a porta-potty, couch, blankets, food, and a stroller. Bateman faces charges of federal kidnapping and tampering with evidence and has pleaded not guilty to all charges.
